level.heading: DENIAL, REVOCATION, OR SUSPENSION OF BINGO, RAFFLE, AND MONTE CARLO NIGHT PARTYICENSES AND SUPPLIERS’ LICENSES (ยง 30-1210)

level.text: The Board may deny any application for a license, or suspend for up to sixty (60) days, or revoke the license of any licensed organization or licensed supplier for any one of the following reasons:
If an applicant for a bingo, raffle or Monte Carlo night party license does not meet the requirements of ยง1200 or 1201;
If an applicant for a bingo, raffle or Monte Carlo night party license does not meet the requirements of ยง 1206;
If the applicant or licensed organization uses false or misleading information to obtain a license;
If the applicant, or licensed organization, or licensed supplier violates any applicable provisions of D.C. Official Code ยง3-1301 et seq. or this title;
Fraudulent or dishonest conduct in the operation of bingo, raffles and Monte Carlo night parties; and
A license issued by the Board is not assignable or transferable.
A license issued by the Board shall remain in effect until the expiration date indicated on the license unless suspended or revoked by the Board.

If the Board denies an application for a license or suspends or revokes a license, the applicant, the licensed organization or licensed supplier is entitled to a hearing in accordance with Chapter 3 of the Board’s rules.

An applicant denied a license, a licensed organization or supplier whose license is suspended or revoked shall receive a written notice of denial, suspension or revocation by certified mail, return receipt requested, stating the following:
The reason for denial, revocation or suspension;
The right to contest the denial, revocation or suspension at a hearing before the Board; and
The right to be represented by counsel or any other person.
